Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
NOTE: A mailbox is different than a distribution group (DG) which is a collection of recipients logically grouped together and addressed as a single recipient.

  • A message addressed to a DG will be delivered to every mailbox of every user in the group.
  • A message addressed to a mailbox will be delivered only to that mailbox, to which others may be granted permission to access.

To create a local Contact Group in Outlook by following the instructions at http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/outlook-help/create-and-edit-a-contact-group-formerly-distribution-lists-HA010354963.aspx .

To request a distribution group, send a message to DL@byui.edu detailing all the folks you'd like to be included in the group.

To request a mailbox:

  1. Mailbox Request Form
  2. Mailbox will be fully-accessible from on and off campus the day after you receive notification that it has been built.

To access an existing mailbox:

    1. Have your supervisor add you to the appropriate role in Role Manager.
    2. Wait up to 3 hours for synchronization to take place.
    3. Restart your computer.
    4. Choose whether you want to access email via a web browser (Outlook Web Access) or email software (Outlook Client)
    Full-Time Employee Student Employee
    Outlook Web Access (OWA)
    1. Use  https://pod51034.outlook.com/owa/YourDepartmentEmailHere@byui.edu/ .
    2. (Optional) Add as a bookmark/favorite or drag a shortcut to your desktop for quick access.

      To send mail from the new mailbox:

      1. Outlook 2010 Client (Windows)
        1. Create new message
        2. Click "From" in the "Show Fields" section of the ribbon bar
        3. Click the "From" drop-down then click "Other email address..."
        4. Type the department address then click "OK"
      • When trying to move a folder with a 2nd mailbox you may get the error message, "Cannot copy this folder because it may contain private items.".
        • This is expected behavior.  In order to move folders you need to do it in the 1st mailbox.
